citation.article-title: The Sulfolobus Caldariella group: taxonomy on the basis of the structure of DNA-dependent RNA polymerases

p.s: Description of Sulfolobus solfataricus sp. nov.
Sulfolobus solfataricus (sol.fa.ta'ri.cus M. L. adj. solfataricus living in solfatara biotopes)
Cells spherical irregular polyhedrons, rounded edges, 0.8-2μm, in colonies on solid media multilobed.
Occurring singly.
Non-motile.
Colonies on polysilicate nutrient plates smooth, flat, greyish, about 2 mm in diameter.
Packed cells have a grey colour.
Elemental sulfur or yeast extract are used as energy source.
With yeast extract, the medium becomes alkaline during growth.
Aerobic
Cell wall devoid of peptidoglycan, but composed of protein subunits arranged in hexagonal dense packing.
Pili are present.
Cells stable at pH 7.
The G + C content of the DNA is 36 moles % (melting point) resp. 40 moles % (buoyant density).
DNA accompanied by a basic polysaccharide.
DNA-dependent RNA polymerase consists of 11 subunits with different molecular weights (Table 3).
Incomplete immunochemical crossreaction with antibody against RNA polymerase from Sulfolobus acidocaldarius.
Mg2+-activated (optimum 3 mM at 30 mM NH+4).
Optimal temperature depends on the template (Fig. 8).
Stable up to 85°C.
Resistant against rifampicin and streptolydigine.
Growth between 50 and 87°C, optimum at 87°C at pH 3.5-5 (Fig. 1).
Isolated from hot acidic volcanic springs.
Type strain: DSM 1616
